info.title: Looker API
info.description: This document is a representative sample (subset) of the Looker API that should only be used to unit test the Looker ruby sdk. To get the current, actual Looker API metadata visit /api/3.0/swagger.json on your Looker instance.

get.description: Get information about the current user; i.e. the user account currently calling the API.

Get information about the user with a specific id.

If the caller is an admin or the caller is the user being specified, then full user information will
be returned. Otherwise, a minimal 'public' variant of the user information will be returned. This contains
The user name and avatar url, but no sensitive information.

delete.description:
Delete the user with a specific id.
**DANGER** this will delete the user and all looks and other information owned by the user.

patch.description: Update information about the user with a specific id.

post.description: Create a user with the specified information.

get.description:
### Get user attribute values for a given user.

Returns the values of specified user attributes (or all user attributes) for a certain user.

A value for each user attribute is searched for in the following locations, in this order:
1. in the user's account information
1. in groups that the user is a member of
1. the default value of the user attribute

If more than one group has a value defined for a user attribute, the group with the lowest rank wins.

The response will only include user attributes for which values were found. Use `include_unset=true` to include
empty records for user attributes with no value.

The value of all hidden user attributes will be blank.

parameters.name: user_attribute_ids
parameters.description: Specific user attributes to request. Omit or leave blank to request all user attributes.

parameters.name: all_values
parameters.description: If true, returns all values in the search path instead of just the first value found. Useful for debugging group precedence.

parameters.name: include_unset
parameters.description: If true, returns an empty record for each requested attribute that has no user, group, or default value.

get.description: Get information about roles of the user with a specific id.

put.description: Set roles of the user with a specific id.

parameters.name: roles
parameters.description: array of roles ids for user

type.description: Type of backup: looker-s3 or custom-s3

custom_s3_bucket.description: Name of bucket for custom-s3 backups

custom_s3_key.description: AWS S3 key used for custom-s3 backups

custom_s3_secret.description: AWS S3 secret used for custom-s3 backups

users_url.description: Link to get list of users with this role

ip_address.description: IP address of user when this session was initiated

city.description: City component of user location (derived from IP address)

state.description: State component of user location (derived from IP address)

country.description: Country component of user location (derived from IP address)

credentials_type.description: Type of credentials used for logging in this session

extended_at.description: Time when this session was last extended by the user

extended_count.description: Number of times this session was extended

sudo_user_id.description: Actual user in the case when this session represents one user sudo'ing as another

created_at.description: Time when this session was initiated

expires_at.description: Time when this session will expire

display_name.description: Full name for display (available only if both first_name and last_name are set)

avatar_url.description: URL for the avatar image (may be generic)

home_space_id.description: ID string for user's home space

access_filters.description: Model access filters. Of the form: '{model => {key => value}, model2 => {key1 => value1, key2 => value2}}'

credentials_looker_openid.description: LookerOpenID credentials. Used for login by Looker Analysts

role_ids.description: Array of ids of the roles for this user

is_looker_employee.description: User is identified as an emplpoyee of Looker

avatar_url.description: URL for the avatar image (may be generic)
